text: i'm willie james hamm
i work for global financial services
as a cloud security consultant
i spent about seven years in the
corporate world and transitioned to a

offer from aws
and i said let's go let's do it
i saw right off the bat a challenge
you know aws has a very strong brand
and i have a pretty broad skill set
and my thinking is why not aim for the
top prior to joining aws i didn't have
any experience with aws even though i
had lots of experience with cloud
so
there was a lot of ramp up learning the
culture and learning the stack
one thing about aws is the sky really is
the limit the the more you're able to
contribute and build the more success
you have
diversity inclusion it means a lot to me
what i found is it's it's actually
really emphasized we have programs that
are specifically designed for affinity
groups currently i belong to ben which
is the black employee network it's
focused on black employment issues and
black employment thought and leadership
what ways can we recruit people
who identify as black what kinds of
things can we do to make their
experience comfortable what are their
interests in terms of building a better
and more inclusive amazon culture that
aws is a great place for people to
really get that feedback as a

sense
of accomplishment when you're able to to
